D8D258D050144A1CA26C511B08945565.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources
to answer a question.

42CBE834882C4D39B17DDE1B2EE1DE7A.description: Record and organize relevant information on a topic

AFF1EAC7419544FAA9A43CA4E76EA5E0.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books
on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

3B727E7E89F946BD959E93B77131FFA9.description: Use digial tools to produce and publish writing individually and with peers

7F465B684BE441EEA3B47B8A8964C743.description: Identify how to use a variety of digital tools

9C93B22473484F5990C9D8FFC314F8B5.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce
and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

F51A5B70ED6E43EC998E8665D1ABA1C5.description: Develop writing by focusing on a topic

1C556A660AED4B52BB802E4C84C28374.description: Identify how to revise and edit

BD6BBF7B9EA647B59CF3CF5CEC884F2B.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen
as needed by revising and editing.

077E14E6430E471D9A9E4809A8F8A09D.description: Create relevant and elaborated details to support events of a narrative

10666C50B7D742A096EA32D6BCDE79AF.description: Apply appropriate temporal words in order to signal change of events in a narrative

164F3F56843A48169C4C080BD0FF6728.description: Determine relevant details that describe actions, thoughts, and feelings

9B3D9BD0393D489B8AFCB611BBB76C78.description: Identify temporal words (ex: before, then, after)

B75AC6CAE1494C7DB65A12545FA4C77F.description: Identify components of narrative including beginning and ending

5569DFDE06D54321B4CBCDA085E966CC.description:
Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of
events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to
signal event order, and provide a sense a order.

A87C93249BED4FC38B0F8329D8CBD0F3.description: Use an appropriate concluding statement or section

6291F192F00D40EAA2B53C3724765C47.description: Use facts and definitions to develop points

0E07D6E78B9B43F498101450B5669C2B.description:
Write informative/explanatory text in which they introduce a topic, use facts and
definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statment or section.

955A5606931E4C5DA87D2960794E003D.description: Use linking words (e.g. because, and, also) in order to connect opinions

028C0A1F71D146D4B4672EECD736575B.description: Organize writing to introduce, support, and conclude

42268C5291A646808C933C8A08E3F34F.description: Provide reasons that support stated opinions

5A06A9E75DA94093B911D78E903FFAD7.description: Formulate an opinion about a text or topic

6AFEFB561826417490F41EBD7B2FF0DC.description: Identify a topic of a book to write about

34598489904F45758BF7D1449CC9D2EF.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing
about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g.,
because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement
or section.

3E62473E510549A7B9A78244B1FF4A9C.description: Differentiate when a situation calls for speaking in complete sentences

0ACCA04D94BF42649F499C32DA8686AA.description: Identify complete sentences in writing and when spoken

4905B16CA6524F169AAC6560ECAB3DEA.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to
provide requested detail or clarification. (See grade 2 Language standards 1 and 3 for
specific expectations.)

18E631F62BBC4DBA941EFBC2573C938A.description:
Determine when to add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of
experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings

1CB450131BD6464E809E5BA4AB531F04.description:
Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual
displays to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas,
thoughts, and feelings.

D00F61E7DB7B4608BBF23AFD615A4E14.description: Determine appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details from a story or experience

1FC06439B6434B549D46742E64C5EB6F.description: Recognize what constitutes an adequate audible volume

BEB52F7C7D06498F9FBE1F00C2600C3A.description: Define what constitutes a coherent sentence

D2FE3BF685FE4B799C93BCC8F1B8F338.description: Identify appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details from a story or experience

C8247FCE347A48F1A17F5DEA8B14E237.description:
Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant,
descriptive details, speaking audibly, in coherent sentences.

ED71C77B5A5B4097A115572A96DC4B44.description:
Formulate appropriate answers about a speaker’s statements to clarify comprehension,
gather additional information, and/or deepen understanding of a topic or issue

B68C7A5252E74D2FA1C61E8CB56BF7E4.description:
Formulate appropriate questions about a speaker’s statements to clarify comprehension,
gather additional information, and/or deepen understanding of a topic or issue

60443BAA85154D5C908E310D2C855889.description: Identify a speaker’s topic or issue

A15BCE54739F4C1FA71ABDF53863B244.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify
comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or
issue.

A9A92422582248A6B422294D164E5095.description:
Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other media.

41F0575B6C7F4F75B36E9E5A9917A98E.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts
under discussion.

61CAE1507A044215B03D098F18A5DAEC.description:
Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their comments to the links of
others.

3100F756162D40748E7E4D8089625BBF.description: Explain agreed upon rules for discussion

9685E77B2552424A975F3354DEC5838E.description: Follow agreed upon rules for discussion.

2DFCF74099DC4F1E851BFE7A28A69990.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2
topics and texts with peers and adults in small and large groups.

1A43AD89EBB04204A3772FD68182F57E.description:
Use words and phrases aquired through conversations, reading and being read to,
and responding to texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When
other kids are happy that makes me happy).

ACEB4602236B4D0B83E04CD2AAA88D59.description: Identify adjectives that have similar meanings

B7D3D93791444C31AD366C8FD452262D.description: Identify verbs that have similar meanings

B318A68684E746ECB6E325887A72595A.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw,
hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

F116DA5C9AAB4C5EAC1926A322CD5711.description: Identify real life connections between words and their use.

2B921F239EA94A3FBC20EB5F29B3FDB1.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

47515A429BE04A1CA19877FCA034C8FC.description: Identify use of glossaries and beginning dictionaries

851309E3DB4B4922A82B8C365375BF74.description:
Use glossary and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or
clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

FD1775C64D75430E9F2905DD663F7EEA.description: Identify and define individual words within the compound word

8C075E8FC17140E88C0FD91D5BA2D2AC.description:
Use knowledge of meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of
compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook,
bookmark).

4A316EDB604849A8BA7CEC323F2B1C95.description: Identify known root words and their meanings

5FEDF70F648A45A6A658DEEA20A74BB3.description:
Use known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the
same root (e.g., addition, additional).

9A7F65F05A07496E984DF83A4B3461E9.description: Explain the meaning of known prefixes

6CF60B9C808D4D9C84DA2E42BCA14123.description: Identify prefixes added to known words

4DCA7A957FA2456DA11B165C236025E5.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to
a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

77B1C0C698394F55B35BC5B233C3F6F8.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

129CE80865104490B879E81462A26BCA.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of
strategies.

0E3F0D36085648898B0475BDFCCAE1C2.description: Identify formal and informal uses of English

2A5F7F33084D4BB2851E35B483346606.description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

61744B9BE73844E1A496C63C3E2423F0.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or
listening.

701A251C066D49CDA434A99AF75E5B29.description:
Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check
and correct spellings

92B507F75DBE49C5A3D411B587A7BE0D.description:
Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage: badge; boy:
boil).

2C65A4480FBC49EE839C5AF5182A1ADE.description: Identify contractions and frequently occuring possessives

92454F8292CA418B85A08AE6EEFFD976.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occuring possessives.

501421195D864DABA9136FFD3CD7F81E.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

1820B5DE776148AFBACE69AC1CC377E7.description: Identify holidays, product names, and geographic names

3CC5378EE1A24CD68FBB18BCC4F1B3A1.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

7FC69CD059824C0A98F3C6F581721E08.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6C3255ECDA184DE4BFB5174E84479DE0.description: Identify complete, simple, and compound sentencesIdentify complete, simple, and compound sentences

5019CDC2E4524491B26AC0BC29147D8E.description: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete, simple and compound sentences.

B89E10779E1943ABB93BACF4ECDCBF34.description:
Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between depending on what is to be
modified.

C8127A8AEFA346BEB2C750FF382D5F32.description: Identify past tense forms or irregular verbs

41E24840BA454F51B93644E2B85A1A24.description:
Form and use the past tense of frequently occuring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid,
told).

DD83653B402046F2B3BC86D8E03C39B8.description: Identify regular and irregular plural nouns

20BD7B2F70004F92B5974773C9704C8B.description:
Form and use frequently occurring regular and irregular plural pronouns (e.g.,
feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

9AF76739CD9E42B1A49F97BD1F493588.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.

75060E4CCB5B41659652BAE94B300621.description: Identify how context can help to confirm or self-correct using context

DA0B1E4282564BFBBAA6791D12E22490.description: Indentify rereading as a strategy when confirming or self-correcting words

B6C51B477077428385532252BBD49C30.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding,
rereading as necessary.

7918F7CA202B4CE9A7A788EA0DD98FF9.description: Apply reading strategies for accuracy, rate, and expression

8089B592180948CC8D4A6DB78790F9A9.description:
Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on
successive readings.

B0545520DEF04C5BAC1F6B1FD57D2542.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding

FE146D77C6214C19B5EFD0A351BFF401.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

C40E7594246545EB90D4B054D409AA8D.description: Distinguish between grade appropriate regularly and irregularly spelled words

913FD9AF33A745568910A64883FAB41E.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

0B30546FA4184D12B08F5219FEE51FBA.description:
Recognize that some words have inconsistent spelling sound correspondence (e.g.,
cow, row, bow, or pint, mint)

A68BA8B33578424BBF2566603F67F27D.description: Identify words with inconsistent, but common spelling-sound correspondences.

F0B0BD0989F04BE283305327065638CE.description: Recognize prefixes and suffixes in words

02B4A0EDBAEF428ABB03D1EFD8DD0025.description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

F4B7C5DA8F254B888970D456E076AD85.description: Identify the rules for long vowels in two syllable words

C34AF0D33C8C4CCABE51496041CAAD3A.description: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long vowels.

09F6FAE9285B470D85C8B84152D82F2C.description: Identify long and short sounds made by vowel teams

D67A7B81C09F485AB74FCD8906590781.description: Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.

F46D5FBA161D4C7E82D451C1ED83CDC4.description: Recognize the rules for long and short vowel sounds

4808CA6BF30A49B79BE28B4A7C440343.description:
Distinugish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable
words.

6986DDD0403D4016B0194811586BB260.description: Know and apply grade level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

2E5D17D9C9F747E4A50E41A7C3D7C018.description:
Read informational text in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently (with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range)

7C14372A721C458C9A02DE4FCDDE6747.description:
Read informational text in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently (with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range)

EDE7E37166BD4791B0155D0B6100C4F8.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational text, including
history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band
proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

B15F2C028C6347E98D383366848FD0A3.description:
Comprehend literature in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently (with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range)

3E4445EAD0D0480C96A96AE4199C1D15.description:
Read literature in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently (with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range)

1ACCD6CD1F724D7F879AFB31F9B0F9FA.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and
poetry, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at
the high end of the range.

D818C7E0F351452D804E82CE75187B09.description: Identify the important points presented in two informational texts on the same topic

125D7007654A4A4B9FF02073FFF9B65A.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points presented two texts on the same
topic.

5BDA6CD2B3814F8BBD64646B5F56FCC6.description: Identify details that support key points in an informational text

1B7D9EA63843496E9A78500BC5FA0B86.description: Identify the key points in an informational text

0BE4A0FED5DC4007A8894004D760C7D6.description: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

7E9B10ED5D8E41ECA908144653A3D6C0.description: Define the terms explain, contribute, and clarify in an informational text

71E0CDECF6904156950B3F9CDBCCDB0C.description: Identify images in an informational text

822F1BA8321549C5AFEA657D09726F2B.description:
Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram how a machine works) contribute to
and clarify a text.

C19055F9296D483E8CD91A8E6928DCE0.description:
Identify characters of two or more versions of the same story written by different authors
or from different cultures

52F92C2517B24B17B0D02BC1153CED81.description:
Recall details and events from two or more versions of the same story written by different
authors or from different cultures

8C7D1BB3F7524EB59938E3F4C349E994.description:
Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella
story) by different authors or from different cultures.

A18FCC23AAFE4253BE15C6F2CCECE00A.description: Explain characters, setting, and/or plot based on illustrations and words in print

6510FD81847744C9862A912D70CA9308.description: Recognize information from illustrations and words in various types of text

AA0674747452427A807976565524B338.description:
Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital to
demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

96751749AF7D48A48409236D3D49DB6D.description:
Read the dialogue in text using appropriate voices for different characters in an
informational text

A510D76EDE81486D92C56DA27403542D.description:
Analyze characters to know what type of voice to use when speaking the part in an
informational text

D47824B5C5404CCA9D81925A016DE8E6.description:
Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer,
explain, or describe.

54D8E42D81DF44A68471A3677B708766.description:
Use various text features (captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, etc.) to
locate key facts or information in an informational text

1D61C78D28EC458585D1379331633728.description: Identify key facts or informationin an informational text

6B7B16FFF4C046B68AD0A8ECABB5584C.description: Identify various text features in an informational text

133FEAD801D543039358DB9F4C10E9E8.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings,
glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text
efficiently.

AC338A75AF524321B31C4BB296A88C5C.description:
Identify words and phrases in an informational text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject
area

6FF7AF2AB5EC415CAB59714C25AAE7BD.description:
Determine meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or
subject area.

A3EEB2F8F4FE4513AFE515B9114162C0.description: Read the dialogue in text using appropriate voices for different characters

81C67F04F2D64E19BBC54055E621773F.description: Determine differences in each character’s point of view

E9F9D2158DA44D268DB9822AE676A619.description: Analyze characters to know what type of voice to use when speaking the part

CC8BA837FCA447FD8F788C56CCB36DF7.description: Recognize dialogue to determine who is speaking

2AC962D5F11F4551968511D805328101.description:
Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking
in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

61BE2083235847C1BE6B75F4CD3F5D67.description: Identify the structure of the story

AA0943FBF7194557AF6944FD0A171FF9.description:
Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning
introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

BD1BC7437D3D4042822822707E95BF0D.description: Recognize rhythm within a story, poem, or song

4F82F67B37184EB7B7C265417FF6F53E.description: Recognize regular beats and repeated lines in a story, poem, or song

2BD2C9790C4946688CC70B84EE540C5A.description: Identify alliteration and other types of figurative language

B12F55E0B71F47E4BFB65C9E1BF2A3E7.description: Identify literal and nonliteral words and phrases

09393E435935438398E33C2F45FA1C83.description:
Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated
lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

BF93410004C647A897324D937D233675.description: Identify the steps in a procedure in an informational text

F13E7B340D784C619C1BF722D49922C9.description: Identify scientific ideas or concepts that occur in an informational text

70CF0341D8F64F2A933A5C29AA205F5B.description: Identify the historical events that occurred in an informational text

B58EB12A0F9640348CE9CDD0A07E61A4.description:
Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or
concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

AC0EDA264D614DF69AE892E5CD29DCDB.description:
Identify the focus of specific paragraphs that support the main topic of an informational
text

78C4E92CDE244A3EBEE49584D3067FD5.description: Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph informational text

20667C8154D94BF1BB688B315FA10D0D.description:
Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph text as well as the focus of specific
paragraphs within the text.

A86E7C96FDED40E0BB03907FA5350FDA.description:
Describe key details in an informational text using the questions who, what, where, when,
why, and how

8DAA0805CDD344F8989A359362B7F4CB.description: Identify key details in an informational text

9B28073F457E48B59B64F4C0AEE91D4E.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to
demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

9449FB00373B455A85A51D3F0D49D189.description: Identify major events or challenges of story

8541E0C2038141568FB61051A381F75B.description: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

269A98AFC93945FDA27D8A3162FE2B17.description: Identify details from stories (e.g., fables and folktales)

F125D737200E4BE4858721563AB61F3B.description: Identify fables and folktales from diverse cultures

20E3792662F1413AB5DD0C4F6F9A5D87.description:
Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine
their central message, lesson, or moral.

57E3212C83824377B367C49F45378131.description: Describe details of the text using who, what, where, when, why, and how

0DDEC497207E490FBDB93BA2DA8A4384.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to
demonstrate underdstanding of key details in text.

5F4ED68251D6454B897663D1509D72D5.description: Second Grade Reading: Literature and Informational Text
